title.narrative: Olof Palme Center - Supporting Inclusive Democratic Transition in DRC
Palmecentret - stöd till inkluderande demokratiska maktskiften i DRK

description.narrative: Based on the findings from the pre-study, this programme proposal focuses on supporting an inclusive democratic transition by reinventing the trade union movement’s role in state building through social dialogue, increase women’s political participation, and strengthening the role of the citizens movement (movement citoyen) in fostering citizen participation and dialogue. The programme will contribute to: • Strengthened democratic institutions and rule of law. • Increased participation of women in elected decision-making forums. • Strengthened capacity of civil society to promote transparency, accountability and improved respect for human rights. The overall goal of the programme is the therefore formulated as Sustainable civil society organisations engage in broad alliances that contribute to the advancement of good governance, labour rights, citizens engagement and women’s equal political participation.

Projektet har utformats efter ett första förstudiebesök i Kinshasa för att bedöma möjligheterna för ett projekt för att stödja inkluderande och demokratisk övergång i Demokratiska republiken Kongo. Det övergripande målet för programmet är "hållbara civilsamhällesorganisationer som deltar i breda allianser som bidrar till att främja god samhällsstyrning, arbetsrätt, medborgarengagemang och kvinnors lika politiska deltagande".
Programmet har tre komponenter; fackföreningar, medborgarrörelser och kvinnoorganisationer, medan den första är den centrala delen av programmet som täcker cirka 50 procent av projektet. De olika komponenterna kommer att innehålla följande:
Fackföreningar: Programmet inkluderar projektfinansiering och kapacitetsstöd för att stärka fackföreningarnas utbildningsvingar och teknisk kunskap om hur man rekryterar nya medlemmar, demokratiskt organiserar och mobiliserar medlemmar och informella arbetare, särskilt kvinnor, underlättar alliansbyggande och nätverkande inom fackföreningsrörelsen, över sektorer och internationellt samt stödja utvecklingen av en gemensam plattform som kan bidra till facklig enhet och främja social dialog.
Medborgarrörelse: Programmet inkluderar projektfinansiering och kapacitetsuppbyggnadsinsatser för att stödja rörelsen att bli mer strategisk och hållbar, förbättra interna demokratiska strukturer, inklusive temafärdigheter inom olika tematiska områden som jämställdhet, social dialog, organisationsutveckling, riskanalys och lindring åtgärder och främja samarbete både inom rörelsen och med andra delar av det civila samhället.
Kvinnors politiska deltagande: Programmet inkluderar projektfinansiering och kapacitetsuppbyggnadsaktiviteter för att stärka kvinnliga politiker och deras förmåga att formulera sina politiska intressen, utveckla ideologibaserat politiskt innehåll och reformer, transparenta och deltagande processer och utbyte med kvinnliga politiker från andra länder.
Palme Center kommer att arbeta tillsammans med partnerorganisationer och medlemsorganisationer för att driva på en progressiv hållbar utveckling och inkluderande demokrati. Att bygga starka allianser mellan sektorer är viktigt för att förverkliga detta.
Programmet kommer att genomföras genom partnerorganisationer som är aktiva i var och en av de tre komponenterna som kommer att bidra till förväntade beteendeförändringar (resultat) i deras respektive sammanhang. Partnerorganisationerna kommer inte var och en av dem att bidra till alla förväntade resultat, men som helhet kommer de att bidra till programmets övergripande mål.

The project has been designed after an initial pre-study visit to Kinshasa to assess the possibilities for a project to support inclusive and democratic transition in the DRC. The overall goal of the programme is "sustainable civil society organisations engage in broad alliances that contribute to the advancement of good governance, labour rights, citizens engagement and women’s equal political participation".
The programme has three components; trade unions, citizens movement and women's organisations, whereas the first one is the central part of the programme covering around 50 percent of the project. The different components will contain the following:
Trade unions: The programme includes project funding and capacity support to strengthen trade unions educational wings and technical knowledge on how to recruit new members, democratically organise and mobilise members and informal workers, particularly women, facilitate alliance building and networking within the trade union movement, cross sectors and internationally and support the development of a common platform that could contribute to trade union unity and promote social dialogue.
Citizens movement: The program includes project funding and capacity building efforts to support the movement to become more strategic and sustainable, improve internal democratic structures, including thematic skills within different thematic areas such as gender equality, social dialogue, organisational development, risk analysis and mitigation measures, and promoting cooperation both within the movement and with other parts of civil society.
Women’s political participation: The program includes project funding and capacity building activities to strengthen women politicians and their capacities to articulate their political interests, develop ideology-based political content and reforms, transparent and participatory processes and exchange with women politicians from other countries.
The Palme Center will work together with partner organisations and member organisations to push for a progressive sustainable development and inclusive democracy. Building strong alliances across sectors is vital to realise this.
The programme will be implemented through partner organisations active in each of the three Components that will contribute to the expected behavioural changes (outcomes) in their respective contexts. The partner organisations will not each of them contribute to all expected outcomes, but as a whole they will contribute to the overall goal of the programme.

description.narrative: The period under review is the initial five months of the project reported in a progress report. The period should also be included in the first regular annual report due 30 April 2022. Therefor this conclusion of performance is less detailed and there are not yet results to assess. The partner, the Palme Center, has during the period under review held digital meetings with selected organisations to reconnect with them after the initial contact during their study visit in Kinshasa in 2020. It was decided to reduce the number of partnership processes from eleven to seven in 2021 and add the last five next year. Some organisations the partner met with were disregarded as implementing partners due to different reasons, such as the fact that they already work with another partner to the embassy or the focus of the organisation. In June 2021, the recruitment process for local representation in Kinshasa was finalised and the person selected started working. The possibility to have in persons meeting with the organisations will facilitate the contact with and assessment/selection of the organisations. Six organisations have filled out organisational descriptions for partnership, the first step of the assessment of the Palme Center. So far, two organisations (one trade union, COSSEP, and one citizen movement, LUCHA, have been invited to start to develop project proposals and will meet with the Palme Center's member organisations such as LO and ABF. This will facilitate the best use of and benefit from the member organisations in the future projects. The organisations will also be assessed by an audit firm for which the Palme Center is currently working on a procurement process. The registration process will be initiated after the summer and is anticipated to take six months. The recruitment process for local representation was finalised and the selected person started just after the period under review. She will be able to meet the selected organisations in person and therefore speed up the selection process.
